text:
## Some minor docstring updates
- corrected grammatical errors
- added some information about the `percentile` value (range)  in both `image.high_variance_confounds` and `signal.high_variance_confounds`, since current documentation is contradictory
## Minor update on default values
- default value of 2 percent of highest variance voxels for `percentile` in both `image.high_variance_confounds` and `signal.high_variance_confounds`, as to comply with the recommendations in the ComCor paper
title: doc string updates and change of default parameter
doc string updates and change of default parameter

title: Pull request merge from rphlypo/nilearn:develop to nilearn/nilearn:master

text:
Looks great in general, but there is a failing test that needs to be addressed:
https://travis-ci.org/nilearn/nilearn/jobs/13528353
It seems that apart from the "dataset" wording detail this is ready to merge. As soon as this issue is sorted out, I'll click the merge button.

> Unless I click it first !

Sure. Feel free
But it seems to me that we have a unresolved issue on the use of the word "datasets"?

> Any idea why the PR can't be automatically merged now ?

It probably means that there is a conflict. Just do it manually.

G

> Merged #126.

Awesome!
As discussed, I think we should also lower the default compcorr number of confounds to 5.
Unless I click it first !
That was a way to say that I'm +1 for merging too.
Yes, once it's solved, we'll merge it. This is the occasion to highlight the issue #75 created by Philippe: we need a glossary.
Any idea why the PR can't be automatically merged now ?
I know it's because of a conflict but it's a bit weird since nobody touched the file ! I've done the merge manually.
test files have been updated accordingly, locally passes the tests for `nilearn/tests/test_signal`
fixed grammatical error + renaming of parameter in docstring
fixed grammatical error + renaming of parameter in docstring
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into develop
changed .gitignore to not track nilearn.egg-info/
docstring updatesfor high_variance_confounds
default values as per the ComCor paper (2 percent of voxels retained)
default to 5 high variance confounds as per the CompCorr paper
changed tests/test_signal.py according to default percentile changes (value lowered to 1., to contrast with default of 2.)
reverted n_datasets to n_subjects
Try to avoid merging when doing a PR.
